segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca:
“katamesaṃ, āvuso anuruddha, dhammānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things have you developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”

segments.pli: “Catunnaṃ, āvuso, satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto.
segments.en: “Reverend, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, kāye kāyānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when I meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
I meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ khvāhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto.
segments.en: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Imesañca panāhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā sahassaṃ lokaṃ abhijānāmī”ti.
segments.en: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly know the entire galaxy.”

suttaplex.blurb: Anuruddha claims to have developed the various direct knowledges by practicing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
